Have you ever postponed or skipped getting health care you needed due to the cost?

Our democracy is in danger. Trump is shredding our Constitution & doing Putin’s bidding.

Know that he couldn’t be doing it w/o Republicans enabling his abuses of power instead of working w/ Democrats to #DefendOurDemocracy.

We must defeat them *all* next year! #PelosiTownHall http://pbs.twimg.com/media/ELEd0LgWsAAsbiR.jpg
The blessings we enjoy were paid for by the struggles of others—activists and fellow Americans who joined together in a conspiracy of love.

Over the past few weeks, the American people have heard the testimony of truly patriotic career public servants, distinguished diplomats and decorated war heroes. The facts presented are uncontested. The President has engaged in abuse of power.

In 1979 students paid $500 a year in today's dollars to attend Cal State University.

Today they pay $7,300.

We're failing our young people, but it's not too late to fix.

We're going to make public colleges, universities and trade schools tuition-free and cancel student debt.

@itsgabrielleu @jay_suth No one should be denied a job, an education, or face discrimination because of their hairstyle. Period. 

That’s why I’m introducing #CROWNAct with @RepRichmond. Because discrimination against black hair is discrimination against Black people. Let’s end it now.

My family relied on food stamps (EBT) when my dad died at 48.

I was a student. If this happened then, we might’ve just starved.

Now, many people will.

It’s shameful how the GOP works overtime to create freebies for the rich while dissolving lifelines of those who need it most. https://twitter.com/nbcnews/status/1202297479556993024 QT @NBCNews BREAKING: Trump admin. has formalized work requirements for recipients of food stamps, a move that will cause nearly 700,000 people to lose access to the Supplemental Nutrition Assistance Program (SNAP). https://nbcnews.trib.al/2NkOr5w

Every day, black people face discrimination just for wearing their natural hairstyles. For expressing their cultural heritage through locs, braids, and more, they’re being fired from jobs, harassed, and denied civil rights. Just take a look ⬇️

Our country was in the midst of a moral moment when Rosa Parks refused to give up her bus seat, sparking the Montgomery Bus Boycott, which began #OTD in 1955. She and her fellow activists inspired millions with their grit, reminding us to never surrender our work for justice. http://pbs.twimg.com/media/ELDl1amWwAAk0Pu.jpg

You want to bring a fight, you bring people together.

RT @jsolomonReports Adam Schiff arbitrarily releases my phone records as a 1st Amendment protected reporter. State Department bureaucrats reportedly monitored my social media. A witness gratuitously drags a 13-year-old boy into impeachment. Whatever happened to civil liberties, privacy and decency?

The American people want action to #EndGunViolence. @federalreserve @RepChuyGarcia Our bank merger bill would force regulators to consider how a bank merger affects consumers’ access to products like mortgages & small business loans. And it would require regulators to reject any bank merger that puts the economy – and working families – at risk.

RT @RBReich When the history of this dreadful Trumpian era of hatefulness and constitution-shredding is written, @nancypelosi and @adamschiff will be among the heroes who preserved American ideals. https://twitter.com/ABCPolitics/status/1202657896007385088 QT @ABCPolitics A reporter asks Nancy Pelosi if she "hates the president."

"I don't hate anybody," she says in a strong response. "As a Catholic, I resent your using the word hate in a sentence that addresses me...Don't mess with me when it comes to words like that." https://trib.al/pdMxwGt http://pbs.twimg.com/amplify_video_thumb/1202657671213662208/img/doKFuI_zjxzDKeOb.jpg https://video.twimg.com/amplify_video/1202657671213662208/vid/320x320/l4T0cq9SrClZX21U.mp4?tag=13
